Indications and doses

Management of oral ulceration,

By buccal administration

  • For adults
    50–100 micrograms twice daily, use inhaler device to spray dose on to the oral mucosa.

Prophylaxis of asthma,

By inhalation of powder

  • For adults
    200–400 micrograms twice daily; increased if necessary up to 800 micrograms twice daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary.
  • For children 5–11 years
    100–200 micrograms twice daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary.
  • For children 12–17 years
    200–400 micrograms twice daily; increased if necessary up to 800 micrograms twice daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary.

Prophylaxis and treatment of allergic and vasomotor rhinitis,

By intranasal administration

  • For adults
    100 micrograms twice daily, dose to be administered into each nostril, reduced to 50 micrograms twice daily, dose to be administered into each nostril, dose to be reduced when symptoms controlled; maximum 400 micrograms per day.
  • For children 6–17 years
    100 micrograms twice daily, dose to be administered into each nostril, reduced to 50 micrograms twice daily, dose to be administered into each nostril, dose to be reduced when symptoms controlled; maximum 400 micrograms per day.

Severe inflammatory skin disorders such as eczemas unresponsive to less potent corticosteroids, Psoriasis,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply 1–2 times a day, thin layer to be applied.
  • For children
    Apply 1–2 times a day, thin layer to be applied.

Adjunct to aminosalicylates in acute mild to moderate ulcerative colitis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    5 mg daily maximum duration of treatment of 4 weeks, dose to be taken in the morning.

Dose equivalence and conversion

Dose adjustments may be required for some inhaler devices, see under individual preparations.

Potency of preperations

Beclometasone dipropionate cream and ointment 0.025%: potent.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With oral use in adults

Manufacturer advises avoid in severe impairment—no information available.

Known side effects

Specific side effects

notKnown: constipation in adults, drowsiness in adults,

Advice for patients and carers

When used by inhalation

Steroid card should be issued with high doses of inhaled beclometasone dipropionate.

When used by inhalation in children

Medicines for Children leaflet: Beclometasone for asthma prevention (prophylaxis)

www.medicinesforchildren.org.uk/beclometasone-inhaler-asthma-prevention-prophylaxis-0

Important safety information

When used by inhalation

MHRA/CHM advice (July 2008)

Beclometasone dipropionate CFC-free pressurised metered-dose inhalers (Qvar and Clenil Modulite ) are not interchangeable and should be prescribed by brand name; Qvar has extra-fine particles, is more potent than traditional beclometasone dipropionate CFC-containing inhalers, and is approximately twice as potent as Clenil Modulite .

When used by inhalation in adults

MHRA/CHM advice (July 2008)

Fostair is a combination beclometasone dipropionate and formoterol fumarate CFC-free pressurised metered-dose inhaler; Fostair has extra-fine particles and is more potent than traditional beclometasone dipropionate CFC-free inhalers.

Unlicensed use

With topical use in children

Not licensed for use in children under 1 year.

With oral (topical) use

Use of soluble tablets and inhaler unlicensed in oral ulceration.

When used by inhalation in children

Easyhaler Beclometasone Dipropionate is not licensed for use in children under 18 years.

Clenil Modulite -200 and -250 are not licensed for use in children under 12 years.

Qvar is not licensed for use in children under 12 years.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

With oral use in children

Safety and efficacy not established for use in children.

When used by inhalation

The MHRA has advised (July 2008) that beclometasone dipropionate CFC-free inhalers should be prescribed by brand name.

Profession specific information

Dental practitioners

When used by inhalation

Clenil Modulite 50 micrograms/metered inhalation may be prescribed.

Exceptions to legal category

With intranasal use in adults

Preparations of beclometasone dipropionate can be sold to the public for nasal administration as a nasal spray if supplied for the prevention and treatment of allergic rhinitis in adults over 18 years subject to max. single dose of 100 micrograms per nostril, max. daily dose of 200 micrograms per nostril for max. 3 months, and a pack size of 20 mg.
